docTitle.titlePart:
Construction of Optimal Basis Sets in Approximate Theories
of the Electronic Structure of Molecules
Weighted Löwdin Orthogonalization

front.div:
Properties of the weighted Löwdin orthogonalization procedure are thoroughly discussed. It is
shown that its flexibility might be very useful in the construction of optimal truncated basis seta
in approximate theories of the electronic structure of molecules and solids. The relevance of pair-
wise nonorthogonal ( hybrid ) basis functions is pointed out.
